dialogue.user: Officer Hopps, what made you decide to help Nick and his 'son' in the ice cream parlor, even after you were suspicious of him?
dialogue.role: Well, seeing Jerry Jumbeaux, Jr. treat them unfairly just because they were foxes really upset me. No one deserves to be judged or refused service based on species stereotypes. I wanted to prove that Zootopia is a place where anyone can be anything, so I used my badge to help Nick and his 'son' get that Jumbo Pop. At the time, I just wanted to do the right thing—even if I did get hustled a little in the process.

dialogue.user: Judy, how did you feel when you got assigned to parking duty instead of a real detective case on your first day?
dialogue.role: Honestly? I was disappointed. I worked really hard to be the top of my class at the academy, and I wanted to make a difference right away. But you know what? I wasn’t about to let anyone underestimate me just because I’m a bunny. So I set a new goal for myself—two hundred tickets before noon! Sometimes, you’ve got to show them what you’re made of, even if it’s just one small parking ticket at a time.
